data.title: Great food, but ownership change, hopefully nothing changes
data.text: This place has great food, good service and I am hoping that doesnt change as a result of the ownership change.  The menu expanded a bit and there were subtle changes, but time will tell whether this is the "to-go" place for local Mexican.

data.title: great casual Mexican food
data.text:
Very reasonably priced, simply prepared, gooood food!
Eat here when in a mood for nachos & enchiladas!  My neighbors and I love the soups, the complimentary chips & salsa,  and the friendly family service.  Been around for years & we never get tired of it!

data.title: Great food and prices.
data.text: Best local margarita!!! My favorite dishes here include the chicken soup, the fish tostada, the pork stew, and the hot chocolate.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food at a great price!
data.text:
We have been eating at this restaurant for many years. The food is authentic and extremely tasty. My favorites are the enchiladas (any type), they are all yummy. Always order the Horchata drink as well. The salsa brought to the table is warm and some of the best we have had.

This business is family run and it seems as if Momma is doing the cooking. Everything tastes as if it was made with love by Mom. Customers are very well taken care of. Worth visiting if you are in the area!!!

data.title: great food
data.text: I love the owners, staff and food of this place.  it's authentic mexican food and the emphasis is on the food.  not pretending to be any thing but a great mexican homey type place.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: The ambiance may not be the best, but the restaurant looks clean.  I got an order to go and the food was excellent.  I will be back!

data.title: Fresh food for a great price!
data.text: This is the only restaurant our entire family could agree on.  The enchiladas are the best I have had anywhere!  It is family owned and operated and the service is great!  The chips and homemade salsa are to 2nd to none. I eat here regularly and take-out when time is short.  When ever our grown kids come home to visit, they always ask if we can have Mexican for one of their meals!  A+ in my book!

data.title: two standout dishes, lengua gordita & al pastor tacos
data.text:
I've only ever had two dishes from Mexico Restaurant in Des Plaines but each time these two dishes deliver all the full flavor I expect.

Lengua Gordita - thick slabs of oh so tender legua (most places I've had lengua it is chopped but not here at Mexico Restaurant), served on a substantial homemade gordita with your choice of salsas (rojo or verde)

Al Pastor Tacos - I've never seen Al Pastor served in the manner they do at Mexico Restaurant. The tacos (3) come wrapped individually in foil in a triangle shape. Personally I prefer the salsa verde with these & the salsa is applied by the restaurant.

This place is well worth a stop if in the area. Being a small family run business, service can sometimes be slow if they are slammed with business, also, don't come for the atmosphere, nothing special here.

data.title: Nothing to write home about
data.text: My husband and I went here for lunch during our recent visit to Des Plaines. Firstly, our serive wasn't that great. The server kept us waiting for nearly 10 minutes before taking our food order. I got the burrito suizo verde with pork. The menu described the green sauce as being spicy, which it definitely wasn't. The pork was nicely cooked but very bland. Then we had to wait for forever to get our check after we were done. During our wait, I saw our server standing in the back, messing with her cell phone. I definitely don't feel the need to visit this place again.

data.title: Good food, good price
data.text: As Des Plaines residents, this is one of our favorites: a wide selection of tasty dishes at reasonable prices. We have eaten here (we usually get take-out) and found the service good and the atmosphere unremarkable.

data.title: A wonderful surprise
data.text: This is a family owned and run business. TRUE Mexican food. Soft drinks and beer imported from Mexico as well as domestic drinks. You know its true Mexican food when there are more Mexicans coming in than others. All are very friendly and helpful.

data.title: We came looking for Via Roma ended up loving this place
data.text:
We were looking for Via Roma per TripAdvisor for a nice meal before departing O'Hare.  Unfortunately Via Roma is only open weekends.  So we just walked up to this non descript "Mexico Restaurant", shrugged our shoulders and decided to give this place a try.  What a great choice.  The 7 in our traveling party all felt their food was excellent, authentic with large portions.  We were all stuffed!  
What a great little find and we'd go back.  Don't let the "diner" look fool you, there is great food to be had here!

data.title: Friendly, Reasonably priced, good food
data.text: The food is authentic and fresh. Great variety. My daughter loves the shrimp cocktail which is like a tasty tomato based cold soup loaded with big, fresh shrimp, avocado, and cucumbers. The shrimp fajitas are out of this world. Enchiladas are all great. Chicken soup is a meal in itself: loaded with fresh ingredients and served with all kinds of extras that you can add to your taste.  The service is friendly and helpful. The dining room is not fancy but large,clean, bright, and comfortable.

data.title: Favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago
data.text: Fantastic authentic Mexican cuisine. Generous portions and friendly service. Highly recommended. 'Nuff said!

data.title: Why eat Mexican elsewhere?
data.text: I have tried all of their dishes and all are great.  My personal favorites are beef tongue in red sauce and pork in green salsa. Their chicken soup is also very special. Enchiladas in mole Poblano are superb. Their margaritas are the best around. Their service is always dependable.

data.title: Best Mexican food around
data.text: This restaurant doesn't look like much (except for the fun mural), but the food is awesome and the friendly service is really nice and refreshing.  The pork green chili is amazing. The gorditos are wonderful and somewhat unexpected. The enchiladas suizas verdes, again with that wonderful green sauce, are amazing. We have had various meat entrees, stews and combos and never been disappointed.  If you're looking for Mexican food in or near Des Plaines, head to Mexico.  Only complaint is that the margaritas are too sweet.  It's not a bar-restaurant; head someplace more upscale for great margaritas. At Mexico, stick to beer or soda and enjoy the amazing food.
